column4: okay, can someone clue me in? I found this in my 3rd party sourc list, and I have no idea what software this might be for.   http://ppa.launchpad.net/ssakar/ppa/ubuntu
any clue at all?!
i'm a newbie and don't know if i should delete that entry or not
If your newbie, why are you adding ppas already?
i added it for something i needed weeks ago, and i do not know what it is there for now.
is the program still installed?
I have no idea what program it is. that was my initial question.......... How would I be able to find out?
you installed a ppa, and you don't even know what it is for?
system > administration > synaptic package manager
search for it read description
or maybe its already in the repo
I have no idea what I'm supposed to be searching for. all I have is this URI to go by in my source list: http://ppa.launchpad.net/ssakar/ppa/ubuntu
search for it in Synatpic read description
search for the name of the program
if the URI is http://ppa.launchpad.net/ssakar/ppa/ubuntu  , would the package name usually be "ssakar"?  because that's not finding anything at all... I guess I should just delete that entry
lets find out what it is hmm
and I guess the link willl tell us that
I'm sure I knew exactly what it was for at the time of installing, I just don't remember. I just recently upgraded to 10.10, so I was going through source list
sudo apt-get purge name of program
that will remove it properly if its installed
and then you can also remove the ppa entry
